snippet: Revisions to a major psychiatric manual would expand recognized addiction symptoms, which could pose huge consequences for insurers and taxpayers.
abstract: Psychiatrists and other specialists rewriting the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders want to expand the list of recognized symptoms for drug and alcohol addiction, while also reducing the number of symptoms required for a diagnosis; revisions could have huge consequences for insurers and taxpayers.
lead_paragraph: Revisions to a major psychiatric manual would expand recognized addiction symptoms, which could pose huge consequences for insurers and taxpayers.
